answers.answer: Flutecrazy, this is terrible that you have gone through all this.Please forget about investigating autoimmune conditions for now.You're tired of your doctors addressing symptoms, yet some of your underlying imbalances and deficiencies are greatly responsible for most of your issues, even if they have progressed to some suspected autoimmune disease.A few critical questions.Have you ever been tested for CELLULAR thyroid function? (not standard serum tests)Have you ruled out vitamin D resistance or vitamin D receptor issues?Were you tested for iron, B12, D and other deficiencies at first?How about your adrenals? have you ever been tested for adrenal fatigue?Cortisol levels, DHEA, etc?Have you been tested for leaky gut syndrome, Candida, hypochloridia,pathogenic mycoplamsa & co-infections including lyme's ?Conventional doctors are not necessarily the best health professionals to address most of the above.Functional Medicine Doctors, Naturopathic Doctors and Holistic Doctors are probably your best bet, except mycoplasma Lyme's and co-infections which are best dealt with by an LLMD.Let me know about these and I can offer you some suggestions.Best wishes.Niko

question: For the past 20 years, I have had chronic fatigue, and fibromyalgia.  I have dry, gritty feeling eyes, dry mouth, osteopenia, diabetes, high cholesterol and triglycerides, Depression, anxiety, and mood swings, have had stress fractures twice in my feet.  I have high blood pressure, steatohepatitis, scarring on the liver, irritable bowel syndrome, frequent and chronic diarrhea.  I have had such opportunistic infections as giardia, c-diff, MRSA sinus infection, and aeromonis in my colon.   In my child bearing years, I had dysfunctional uterine bleeding, and multiple miscarriages.  I currently am anemic and have had frequent deficiencies in B12, magnesium, Vit D, Folic Acid and iron.  I have begun to have diabetic kidney disease.  I see a chiropractor for chronic migraines, muscle and back pain.  I have frequent bloating, right upper quadrant tenderness, (post cholecystectomy), frequent sudden onset vomiting.   Chronic sinusitis, balance and memory issues and had a subarachnoid hemorrhage in 2012.  I also have mild sleep apnea, and excessive daytime sleepiness.When I go for x-rays, tests, etc, many times they are negative, yet the problems are very real.Any idea what autoimmune disorder, I may have if any.   All I get from doctors is addressing symptoms of particular things, but no one wants to look at the entire picture.   Please advise,Thank youFrequently,
